DOC.brief_title: Antenatal Late Preterm Steroids ( ALPS ) : A Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Antenatal Late Preterm Steroids ( ALPS ) : A Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial : The rate preterm birth steadily increase United States past 10 year . This increase driven part rise rate late preterm birth , define birth occur 34 36 week . Late preterm infant experience high rate readmission term counterpart , infant likely suffer complication respiratory distress , kernicterus , feed difficulty , hypoglycemia . Late preterm infant also high mortality cause compare term infant . The use antenatal corticosteroid show beneficial woman risk preterm delivery prior 34 week evaluate likely deliver late preterm period . If show reduce need respiratory support thus decrease rate special care nursery admission improve short-term outcome , public health economic impact considerate . This protocol describe randomize placebo control trial evaluate whether antenatal corticosteroid decrease rate neonatal respiratory support , thus decrease rate neonatal intensive care unit ( NICU ) admission improve short-term outcome late preterm infant .

Preterm labor intact membrane . Preterm labor define least 6 regular uterine contraction observation period 60 minute least one following : cervix great equal 3cm dilate 80 % efface Planned delivery induction labor cesarean section le 24 hour 7 day , deem necessary provider . An induction must schedule start 36,5 week late , whereas cesarean delivery must schedule 36,6 week late . Therefore late gestational age randomization 36,4 week plan induction . The planned delivery may indication , follow : prior myomectomy , prior classical cesarean , intrauterine growth restriction ( IUGR ) , oligohydramnios , preeclampsia , nonreassuring fetal heart rate trace warrant delivery , abruption , placenta previa Rupture Membranes ( ROM ) satisfy protocol criterion exclude patient evaluate Preterm Premature Rupture Membranes ( pPROM ) preterm labor plan delivery satisfy spontaneous membrane rupture criterion ( 2 : positive Nitrazine test , pool fluid vaginal vault test ferning vaginal fluid ; indigo carmine pool vagina amnioinfusion ; visible leakage amniotic fluid cervix ) Preterm labor satisfy protocol criterion exclude patient intact membrane delivery plan contraction 10 minute apart cervix less 3cm dilate less 80 % effaced Fetal death / major fetal anomaly / fetus nonviable exclude patient major fetal anomaly fetus viable Delivery expect < 12 hour randomization include 1 ) rupture membrane cervical dilation ≥ 3cm 6 contraction per hour unless pitocin defer least 12 hour 2 ) evidence nonreassuring fetal status require immediate delivery 3 ) chorioamnionitis 4 ) Cervical dilation ≥ 8 cm Prior corticosteroid fetal lung maturity exclude patient give corticosteroid fetal lung maturity 34 week Systemic corticosteroid indication exclude patient give systemic corticosteroid indication fetal lung maturity No ultrasound < 20 week unsure last menstrual period ( LMP ) .
